title: Hear the moment Deputy Tadier was kicked out of States Chamber
text:
Deputy Montfort Tadier was kicked out of the Jersey States Chamber earlier today, after making a comment about Jesus.
He was saying "Of course he (Jesus) would be there at the Tory conference sitting with the Institute of Directors" when he was interrupted by the Bailiff who said the comment was offensive.
Deputy Tadier went on to explain that he was using rhetoric to make the point that Jesus "wouldn't have been there (at the Tory party conference)".
Hear the exchange below.
Play video I don't accept that I made any offensive statement, in fact I was cut down in the middle of my sentence and if I had been allowed to finish it, members would have quite easily realised where I was going with it.
– Deputy Montfort Tadier Following the initial exchange the Bailiff asked him to withdraw the comment, which he refused.
The Bailiff then Quote: d two orders which meant he could expel the Deputy.
Senator Ian Gorst stepped in to say "I wasn't offended with regard to what he (Deputy Tadier) was saying about faith".
When Tadier still refused to withdraw the comment, he was expelled from the Chamber for one hour.
Deputy Geoff Southern and Deputy Sam Mezec also left in protest.
The Chamber then voted to adjourn for an hour while Deputy Montfort was expelled.
You can hear the moment Deputy Montfort was told to leave below.
Play video I'd like to give you (The Bailiff) an opportunity to withdraw from the chair and allow the Greffier to chair Sir, as I think that you've overstepped the mark on this one.
– Deputy Montfort Tadier The full sequence of events is available to listen to below.
